Date: January 8, 2025

title: ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy - The Indian Express
summary:
ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Indian Express

The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) has released the First Advance Estimates (FAEs) of India’s GDP growth for the financial year 2024-25. These estimates suggest that India's nominal GDP is projected to reach Rs 324 lakh crores, growing 9.7% over the previous financial year.

  • The estimated nominal GDP for FY25 is $3.8 trillion at the exchange rate of 85 rupees to a dollar.
  • Real GDP is expected to be Rs 184.9 lakh crores, accounting for 57% of nominal GDP, indicating a growth deceleration.
  • Private consumption demand (PFCE) plays a crucial role, contributing almost 60% to GDP.
  • Government spending growth has been slow, averaging just 4.2% for the current year.
  • Investments have stalled since 2014, leading to reduced productive capacity growth.
"When one considers a slightly longer period, it becomes clear that India’s real economy is growing at less than 5% per annum."

The latest GDP figures serve as a reality check, revealing that while India's growth appears strong, much of this is boosted by a low base effect from the pandemic's economic contraction.
newTitle: India's Economic Outlook: Insights from the Latest GDP Estimates

title: Gold rallies as concerns swell over US debt and upcoming bond auctions for this week - FXStreet
summary:
Gold pops as concerns on rates and inflation in the US grow again after red hot ISM Services report

Date: January 7, 2025

Source: FXStreet

Gold price sees upward momentum as markets react to increasing concerns over US debt issuances and inflation following a strong ISM Services report.

  • US markets are preparing for substantial debt issuances, raising concerns about potential increases in interest rates.
  • The ISM Services sector report indicated inflationary pressures, which negatively affected expectations for interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.
  • Gold prices are stabilizing within a tactical formation, with upward and downward trends noted.
  • The US 10-year yield has reached an eight-month high due to inflation concerns.
  • Market speculations suggest that significant reactions to the new administration's tariff plans could influence gold prices.
"A stronger position for gold can be expected if patterns become clearer amid the ongoing economic tensions."

The article emphasizes the uncertainty in financial markets and the pivotal role of gold as a hedge against inflation in turbulent economic times.
newTitle: Gold Prices Rise Amid US Economic Concerns

title: Mahindra XEV 9e, BE 6 top variant prices announced; Check battery range, features, booking dates here - The Economic Times
summary:
Mahindra XEV 9e, BE 6 top variant prices announced; Check battery range, features, booking dates here

Date: Tuesday
Source: Economic Times

Introduction

Mahindra and Mahindra has unveiled the prices for its electric SUVs, the Mahindra XEV 9e and BE 6, with various options and features designed for consumers eager for electric vehicle options.

Key Points

  • The Mahindra XEV 9e is priced at Rs 30.90 lakh for the top variant with a 79 kWh battery.
  • The BE 6 top-spec variant will retail at Rs 26.9 lakh.
  • Bookings for both SUVs will commence on February 14, with test drives starting January 14.
  • Deliveries of the XEV 9e will begin in March 2025, while the BE 6 deliveries are expected in early March.
  • The XEV 9e features two battery options (59kWh and 79kWh) and claims a range of 656km on the MIDC cycle.
  • Both models come equipped with advanced technology like a three-screen setup, augmented reality head-up displays, and a comprehensive ADAS suite.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“The 79kWh battery can be charged from 20 to 80 percent in 20 minutes using a 175kW DC fast charger.”

Conclusion

Mahindra’s new electric SUVs promise exciting features and competitive pricing, catering to the growing market for electric vehicles in India.
newTitle: Mahindra XEV 9e and BE 6 Price Announcement and Features Overview

title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO: Issue subscribed 15.86 times on day 1; check details here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO: Issue subscribed 15.86 times on day 1; check details here

Publication Date: January 7, 2025; Source: Live Mint

The initial public offering (IPO) of Quadrant Future Tek opened for subscription today, January 7, and saw exceptional interest, being subscribed over 15.86 times on the first day.

  • The IPO received bids for 9,18,47,850 shares against the offered 57,99,999 equity shares.
  • The price band for the shares is set between ₹275-290.
  • Retail and Non-Institutional portions were significantly oversubscribed at 54.84 times and 21.51 times, respectively.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyer portion received only 0.05 times subscription.
  • The company aims to raise ₹290 crore from this fresh issue.
  • Notable anchor investors included Citigroup, Capri Global, and various mutual funds.

Link Intime India Private Limited is the official registrar, while Sundae Capital Advisors acts as the lead manager for the public issue.

“Quadrant is a research-oriented company engaged in developing new generation Train Control and Signalling Systems for Indian Railways.”

This IPO marks a significant step for Quadrant Future Tek as it seeks to enhance operational capabilities and expand its market presence.
newTitle: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Subscribed 15.86 Times on Day 1

title: Temasek nears deal to buy 10% stake in Haldiram at $10 billion valuation - Business Standard
summary:
Temasek Approaches Deal for 10% Stake in Haldiram Valued at $10 Billion

Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

After prolonged negotiations, Singapore government-owned investment firm Temasek is nearing a deal to acquire a 10 per cent stake in Haldiram Snacks Foods, with a valuation of $10 billion.

  • Temasek and the Agrawal family have signed a term sheet for the sale.
  • Other PE firms, including Bain Capital and Blackstone, also made offers.
  • Temasek plans to conduct due diligence and make a binding offer within a month.
  • Potential listing of Haldiram within a year to take advantage of the IPO boom.
  • Temasek's focus includes significant investments in healthcare and consumer products in India.
“Haldiram Snacks reported revenue of Rs 6,375 crore in FY23, up from Rs 5,195 crore in FY22.”

This transaction could reshape the investment landscape of India's consumer products sector, with Temasek looking to increase its footprint in the region.
newTitle: Temasek Approaches Deal for 10% Stake in Haldiram Valued at $10 Billion

title: OYO Results: Hotels chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drop 15% | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
OYO Results: Hotels chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drop 15%

Date & Source: March 2024, Live Mint

OYO Hotels and Homes Pvt. Ltd. has reported a net profit for FY2024, despite a significant drop in operational revenue compared to the previous year.

  • The company reported a net profit of ₹114.64 crore for FY2024, an improvement from the previous year's loss.
  • Operational revenue decreased by 15%, totaling ₹1,112.83 crore.
  • OYO achieved its first positive EBITDA since 2020, reported at ₹153 crore.
  • Total revenue for March 2024 was ₹1,179 crore, compared to ₹1,400 crore in the previous year.
  • OYO's first-ever post-tax profit was ₹229 crore, exceeding earlier profit projections.
  • Earnings per share improved to approximately ₹0.36 from a loss of ₹1.93 per share in FY23.
  • The company expanded its hotel portfolio significantly, growing inventory from 12,938 to 18,103 hotels.
“The company's reported profits for FY24 significantly exceeded CEO Ritesh Agarwal's earlier projection of ₹100 crore.”

In conclusion, OYO's financial recovery in FY2024 is notable, highlighting a turnaround amidst declining revenue but with an expansion in its hotel operations.
newTitle: OYO Hotels Reports ₹114.64 Crore Profit Despite Revenue Decline

title: NCLAT approves merger between Equinox India and Embassy Group - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
NCLAT Approves Merger of Equinox India and Embassy Group

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 2:08 pm

The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has approved the merger between Equinox India Developments and Embassy Group, overturning a previous NCLT ruling that halted the merger.

  • The NCLAT ruled against objections raised by a minor shareholder regarding the merger.
  • The process received overwhelming support from 99.9987% of equity shareholders.
  • The merger was assessed and approved by the Competition Commission of India.
  • Valuation discrepancies raised by the Income Tax Department were addressed satisfactorily.
  • The NCLAT emphasized the judicial wisdom of shareholders and creditors in approving the scheme.
“After going through the facts and circumstances... we hold that Ld. NCLT, Chandigarh has erred in interfering in the Scheme ignoring the commercial wisdom of shareholders...”

The ruling allows the merger to proceed while stating that the Income Tax Department can still take action to protect revenue interests.
newTitle: NCLAT Approves Merger of Equinox India and Embassy Group

title: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta to replace third-party fact-checkers with community notes like ‘X’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Meta's Shift: Community Notes Replace Third-Party Fact-Checkers

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Meta has announced plans to replace its third-party fact-checking program with a community notes system, similar to the model on X (formerly Twitter), starting in the United States. This decision is based on the belief that expert fact-checkers carry biases and contribute to a loss of trust.

  • Meta will begin scrapping the third-party fact-checking program in the US.
  • Mark Zuckerberg highlighted that fact-checkers have been politically biased.
  • The new community notes approach aims to empower users in determining misleading posts.
  • Meta plans to allow more speech by lifting restrictions on certain topics.
  • Zuckerberg expressed that recent US elections signify a cultural shift towards prioritizing speech.
  • Meta intends to move its trust and safety teams from California to Texas to combat perceived bias.
  • The company will also reverse its 2021 policy that reduced political content visibility.
“We're going to get rid of fact-checkers and replace them with community notes similar to X (formerly Twitter), starting in the US.” - Mark Zuckerberg

This shift reflects Meta's effort to restore trust and move towards a more community-driven approach in content moderation.
newTitle: Meta's Shift: Community Notes Replace Third-Party Fact-Checkers

title: Aakash Institute tells NCLT it urgently needs funds to sustain operations - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Aakash Institute Urgently Seeks Funds Amid Legal Battles

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 1:30 pm

Coaching giant Aakash Education Services has informed the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) that it urgently needs to raise funds to sustain its operations amid ongoing legal disputes.

  • Aakash has pleaded with the NCLT to vacate a stay that is affecting its funding efforts.
  • The institute employs 5,000 staff and caters to 3.5 lakh students.
  • Manipal Systems is identified as the key entity that can provide the necessary funds.
  • The legal challenges arise from a proposed amendment to Aakash's Articles of Association that Singapore Topco opposes.
  • The Karnataka High Court and Supreme Court have been involved in the case, impacting the procedural timeline.
“These are physical classes. We have 5,000 teaching and non-teaching staff and 3.5 lakh students. We need to raise funds.” - Senior Advocate CK Nandakumar

The case has been adjourned to January 21 for further proceedings.
newTitle: Aakash Institute Urgently Seeks Funds Amid Legal Battles

title: Apple fires 185 employees over fraudulent donations scheme, including several Indians: Report | Today News - Mint
summary:
Apple fires 185 employees over fraudulent donations scheme, including several Indians: Report

Date: October 2023, Source: India Today

Tech giant Apple has fired 185 employees in Cupertino as part of an investigation into fraudulent activities within its charitable Matching Grants program.

  • Employees collaborated with non-profits to falsify donations for personal gain.
  • Six individuals identified as part of the scheme allegedly defrauded Apple of approximately $152,000.
  • The fraudulent activities also involved tax evasion related to fictitious donations.
  • Many of the terminated employees reportedly have connections to the Indian community.
“These individuals defrauded Apple of approximately $152,000 over a three-year period,” stated the Santa Clara County district attorney’s office.

The situation continues to unfold as investigations by the district attorney’s office persist, reflecting on an alarming misuse of corporate social responsibility programs.
newTitle: Apple Terminates 185 Employees Amid Fraudulent Donations Scheme

title: Getty Images and Shutterstock to merge to form $3.7B stock photo giant - TechCrunch
summary:
Getty Images and Shutterstock to merge to form $3.7B stock photo giant

Publication Date: Tuesday, January 3, 2025   |   Source: TechCrunch

Getty Images has announced a merger with rival Shutterstock in a deal valued at $3.7 billion, allowing Getty to own approximately 54.7% of the new company.

  • The merger combines the strengths of both companies in the stock photo and video footage market.
  • Shutterstock shareholders can choose between cash or stock options as part of the deal.
  • The merger comes amid a changing landscape for the stock image industry due to the rise of artificial intelligence.
  • Concerns exist about potential antitrust scrutiny of the merger.
“Today’s announcement is exciting and transformational for our companies, unlocking multiple opportunities to strengthen our financial foundation and invest in the future,” said Getty Images CEO Craig Peters.

This merger is positioned to reshape the stock image industry significantly, amidst both opportunities and threats posed by emerging technologies.
newTitle: Getty Images and Shutterstock to merge to form $3.7B stock photo giant

title: Upcoming Hyundai Creta Is Now Safer! - MotorOctane
summary:
Upcoming Hyundai Creta Is Now Safer!

Date: Recent

Source: MotorOctane

Hyundai is gearing up to launch its new Creta EV in India, enhancing its safety features to meet buyer demands.

  • The new Creta EV will feature more than 75 advanced safety features, with 52 as standard across all variants.
  • The vehicle includes a level 2 ADAS suite and is built with advanced high-strength steel for better protection.
  • Safety features such as six airbags, Hill Start and Descent Control, and a 360-degree view camera will be part of the package.
  • Interiors feature advanced technologies including an in-car payment system and dual 10.25-inch screens.
  • The EV offers two battery options (51.4 kWh generating 169 bhp and 42 kWh generating 133 bhp) and ranges of 473 km and 390 km, respectively.
  • Hyundai aims to attract previous buyers who found the Creta lacking in safety.
“The new model gets more than 75 advanced safety features out of which 52 are standard across all variants.”

This new iteration of the Hyundai Creta not only enhances safety but also modernizes the SUV, potentially capturing the attention of safety-conscious consumers.

summary:

Source: The Economic Times

The Nifty index has shown mixed signals, forming an Inside Bar candle near the 23,700 mark. A breach below 23,600 could signal further corrections, while resistance levels are identified at 23,800 and 24,000.

  • Nifty closed near 23,700, with immediate support levels at 23,400 and 23,000.

title: OYO Results: Hotel chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drops 15% | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
OYO Results: Hotel chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drops 15%

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: Live Mint

OYO Hotels and Homes Pvt Ltd reported a net profit of ₹114.64 crore for FY2024, a significant turnaround from the previous year's loss. However, operational revenue fell by 15% to ₹1,112.83 crore compared to the prior year.

  • Net profit for FY2024 is ₹114.64 crore, in contrast to a net loss in FY2023.
  • Revenue for March 2024 is ₹1,179 crore, down from ₹1,400 crore in the previous year.
  • EBITDA rose to ₹153 crore, marking a positive EBITDA for the first time since 2020.
  • Adjusted EBITDA surged by 215% to ₹877 crore in FY24.
  • Total expenses decreased by 13% to ₹4,500 crore in FY24.
“The company reported its first-ever post-tax profit of ₹229 crore for FY2024, exceeding earlier projections of ₹100 crore.”

In conclusion, despite the decline in revenue, OYO has demonstrated improved profitability and operational efficiency, which bodes well for future growth.
newTitle: OYO Reports ₹114.64 Crore Net Profit in FY2024 Despite Revenue Decline

title: Meta drops fact-checking and loosens its content moderation rules - TechCrunch
summary:
Meta drops fact-checking, loosens its content moderation rules

Date: January 2025 | Source: TechCrunch

Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has announced significant changes to its content moderation policies, including the end of its third-party fact-checking program.

  • The third-party fact-checking program will be replaced by a Community Notes model.
  • Restrictions on mainstream discussion topics will be lifted, focusing instead on illegal and severe violations.
  • Users will be encouraged to personalize their political content, allowing for more opinion-based feeds.
“Meta’s platforms are built to be places where people can express themselves freely.” - Joel Kaplan, Chief Global Affairs Officer

These changes come as Meta adjusts to a new political landscape in the U.S., aiming to balance free expression with moderation while responding to public criticism of its previous policies.
newTitle: Meta Loosens Content Moderation Rules Amid Criticism

title: Q3 earnings preview: Worst may be behind, but are we in for a stellar show? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Q3 earnings preview: Worst may be behind, but are we in for a stellar show?

Date: October 2023
Source: Live Mint

Indian corporates are facing challenges as quarterly earnings show subdued results, with minimal expectations for robust recovery in Q3. Experts suggest caution for investors hoping for significant improvements.

  • Q1 and Q2 earnings were weak, leading to a market correction.
  • 45% of companies missed earnings estimates in Q2 according to JM Financial.
  • Experts expect minor improvements in banking and IT sectors, but overall recovery in Q3 is unlikely.
  • Nifty 50 companies excluding certain sectors may report 10% revenue growth in Q3.
  • Corporate profit margins are under pressure, especially in Q2.
"Due to central and state elections, spending has picked up with a lag from December 2024 onwards. One should not expect too many fireworks from corporate India in Q3FY25," says Pawan Parakh.

The outlook for Q4 may be more optimistic as recovery is anticipated, contingent on factors like IT spending and geopolitical stability.
newTitle: Q3 Earnings Preview: Challenges Ahead for Indian Corporates

title: Microsoft to invest $3 billion in India, to expand AI and cloud capacity - Reuters
Gainers & Losers: Zomato, ONGC among 10 stocks that moved the market today - The Economic Times
GDP growth projected to fall to four-year low at 6.4% - The Hindu
summary:
India’s real GDP expected to rise 6.4% in FY25

Published: January 07, 2025, Source: National Statistics Office

India’s real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is expected to rise 6.4% in this financial year, slowing from 8.2% in 2023-24, according to the National Statistics Office (NSO).

  • GDP growth slowed to 6% in the first half of the financial year.
  • Agriculture GVA growth is projected to increase to 3.8% from 1.4% last year.
  • Public Administration, Defence, and Other Services GVA is expected to rise 9.1%.
  • Manufacturing GVA growth is expected to drop to 5.3% from 9.9% in the last fiscal year.
  • Private final consumption spending is estimated to expand by 7.3%.
“The economy’s engines will slow to a four-year low this fiscal.”

In summary, the NSO's estimates indicate a significant slowing of economic growth for India, highlighting the need for measures to reinvigorate the economy.
newTitle: India’s real GDP expected to rise 6.4% in FY25

title: India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates - The Times of India
summary:
India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Times of India

The Indian government recently released estimates indicating that the GDP growth rate for the fiscal year 2025 is expected to slow to 6.4%, a significant drop from 8.2% in the previous year. This slowdown raises concerns about economic stability and growth prospects in the country.

  • The GDP growth rate is projected to fall to 6.4% for FY25.
  • This is a decrease from the 8.2% growth rate recorded in FY24.
  • Experts suggest various factors, including inflation and global economic conditions, are impacting growth.
  • The government is expected to implement measures to stimulate the economy.
"The reduction in GDP growth highlights the challenges facing the Indian economy moving forward." - Economic Analyst

The shift to a lower growth forecast underscores the imperative for reforms to bolster economic performance in the coming years.
newTitle: India's GDP Growth Slows to 6.4% for FY25: Government Estimates

title: India's GDP growth seen to slow sharply to 6.4% in FY25 from 8.2% last year, first advance estimate shows - The Economic Times
Top Tech Trends of 2025: AI-powered everything - Capgemini
summary:
Top Tech Trends 2025: A Comprehensive Overview

Date: 2024-12-01
Source: Capgemini

This report explores five critical technology trends that are expected to shape the business landscape in 2025. It emphasizes understanding emerging technologies for future planning.

  • Generative AI's impact on various industries
  • The evolving role of AI in cybersecurity
  • AI-driven robotics enhancing productivity
  • Implications of nuclear energy advancements for sustainability
  • Evolution of agile, greener supply chain management

“In 2025, we see AI and Gen AI having a major impact on companies’ priorities and also on many adjacent technology domains.” - Pascal Brier

This comprehensive analysis provides insights for business leaders on navigating the complexity of future technology trends.
newTitle: Top Tech Trends 2025: A Comprehensive Overview
